relatedBlades.title: A digital native mindset to cyber security
relatedBlades.copy: Digital natives are taking advantage of Zero Trust and leading a change in cyber security — here are the top 5 benefits they are experiencing.

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - Future Internet - A digital native mindset to cyber security - Image

features.title: ChatGPT impersonators reveal security vulnerability
features.description: With popularity comes risks — Shadow AI multiplies the risks of Shadow IT with the surge in fraudulent and malicious applications designed to infiltrate and steal data

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - Future Internet - ChatGPT impersonators reveal security vulnerability - Image

features.title: Can AI find vulnerabilities?
features.description: Why AI is a double-edged sword when it comes to security and how to future-proof against vulnerability exploits

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Future Internet - Can AI find vulnerabilities? - Image

features.title: 2024 vision: 10 predictions for technology leaders
features.description: Anticipating the future of cyber security and IT: Considerations as you prepare your organization's strategies and priorities for the next 12 months

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - 2024 vision: 10 predictions for technology leaders - Image

features.title: Overcoming the challenges of data sovereignty
features.description: More than 100 countries have enacted laws aimed at protecting the privacy of their citizen's personal information—and that's a good thing. However, complying with these laws can pose serious challenges to global businesses.

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Future Internet - Overcoming the challenges of data sovereignty - Image

features.title: Securing LLMs
features.description: 10 types of large language model (LLM) attacks and the risk they introduce when embedded in applications

features.title: Using AI in cyber defenses
features.description: The sophistication of threats warrants new security methods — by leveraging AI, organizations can adapt in real time

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Future Internet - Using AI in cyber defenses - Image

features.title: Ideas for using generative AI safely
features.description: New security threats rise to the surface with every transformative technology. Each time, the industry has responded by tightening security, protocol, and process —  the same will happen with AI.

features.title: Protecting data from AI
features.description: When used without being mindful of the limitations and risks AI tools present — they can not only hamper the development process but also cause harm to the organizations using them

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - Future Internet - Protecting data from AI - Image

features.title: Should you ban employee use of AI?
features.description: Examining the benefits and risks of AI-based large language models so CISOs can determine if they should allow or ban ChatGPT and other generative AI tools

features.title: Securing the AI revolution everywhere
features.description: There is incredible opportunity in using AI, but this technology also presents challenges that may be addressed through cyber security.

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Future Internet - Securing the AI revolution - image

features.title: The Internet is the new corporate network
features.description: Shifting from an on-premise infrastructure to a cloud-connected model affords organizations more flexibility than ever before — but it brings its own challenges as well

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Future Internet - The Internet is the new corporate network - Image

features.title: Showing egress fees the exit
features.description: AI requires access to massive amounts of data and significant computing power — storage and data management then, become a large expense in developing AI systems

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Security Innovation - Showing egress fees the exit - Image

features.title: AI is here: How can businesses stay secure?
features.description: AI will no doubt will be a game-changer in our hyper-connected digital world. As organization adopt AI into their operations, they must also be proactive to secure themselves from the potential of AI-run cyberattacks

imageAssetFile.title: theNET - CxO Digital Magazine - Future Internet - AI is here: How can businesses stay secure? - Image

features.title: A new CXO emerges: CZTO
features.description: Zero Trust is no longer simply a concept; it is now a requisite. Who 'exactly' is accountable?
